intro: Lagenophora neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonian lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
